snippet: Two journalists from West Islip High School on Long Island set out to examine school security measures, but they were prosecuted for trespassing and their article was quashed.
abstract: Paula Pecorella and Nicholas Krauss, West Islip High School, Long Island, student journalists who set out to examine school security measures but were prosecuted for trespassing, say they deserve credit for exposing poor school security; all charges against Pecorella and Krauss will be dismissed if there are no other arrests within six months.
lead_paragraph: Two journalists from West Islip High School on Long Island set out to examine school security measures, but they were prosecuted for trespassing and their article was quashed.

headline.main: Seeking Exposé, Students End Up in Handcuffs
headline.print_headline: Seeking Exposé, Students End Up in Handcuffs
